docs.abstract: The billionaire developer says he is in the presidential race to stay, but his recent comments suggest he may be considering his options.

headline.main: From Donald Trump, Hints of a Campaign Exit Strategy
headline.print_headline: Amid Talk of Winning, Trump Appears to Keep His Options Open

docs.lead_paragraph: In unmistakable ways over the last two weeks, whether he has intended to or not, Donald J. Trump has started to articulate a way out of the presidential race: a verbal parachute that makes clear he has contemplated the factors that would cause him to end his bid.
docs.snippet: The billionaire developer says he is in the presidential race to stay, but his recent comments suggest he may be considering his options.

docs.abstract: Lionel Messi scored two goals and set up a third as Barcelona beat Bayern Munich, 3-0, and took a giant step toward the Champions League final.

headline.main: Barcelona’s Lionel Messi Carves Up Bayern Munich in Champions League Semifinals

docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain — He knew. Of course he knew. Pep Guardiola spent four remarkable years as the coach at Barcelona, won 14 trophies at Barcelona, saw Lionel Messi score more than 200 goals for Barcelona. When Guardiola, who now coaches Bayern Munich, said Tuesday that Messi was “unstoppable,” it was not hyperbole. It was simply the truth from a man who could not lie.
docs.snippet: Lionel Messi scored two goals and set up a third as Barcelona beat Bayern Munich, 3-0, and took a giant step toward the Champions League final.

docs.abstract: The world has a long, inexcusable history of taking children away from their parents.

headline.main: Trump Wasn’t First to Separate Families, but Policy Was Still Evil
headline.print_headline: Taking Kids Wasn’t New, Just Evil

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump finally caved to public pressure and promised to stop separating children from parents at the border. After long insisting that he couldn’t do anything about this, he snapped his fingers and changed the policy that he had denied was a policy.
docs.snippet: The world has a long, inexcusable history of taking children away from their parents.

docs.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s campaign has ceased running a new negative ad against Senator Ted Cruz in South Carolina, a sign that the candidate may be emphasizing a more positive tone at this point in the battle in that state.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Campaign Pulls a Negative Ad on Ted Cruz
headline.print_headline: Trump Campaign Pulls Anti-Cruz Ad And Plans Shift to Positive Messages

docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, Donald J. Trump’s campaign started running a negative ad in South Carolina against Senator Ted Cruz that was searing, describing the winner of the Iowa Republican caucuses as a fake and a “Washington insider.”
docs.snippet: Donald J. Trump’s campaign has ceased running a new negative ad against Senator Ted Cruz in South Carolina, a sign that the candidate may be emphasizing a more positive tone at this point in the battle in that state.

docs.abstract: The Republican presidential candidate has shown a lenient side in the vetting of campaign officials who turn out to have come with red flags.

headline.main: Donald Trump Hires First and Deals With Background Questions Later
headline.print_headline: Trump Seems to Hire First, and Deal With Background Questions Later

docs.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump has called for “extreme vetting” to determine who is allowed to enter the United States, but when it comes to his presidential campaign, he has shown a propensity to be lenient when it comes to the kinds of red flags that might scare off other candidates.
docs.snippet: The Republican presidential candidate has shown a lenient side in the vetting of campaign officials who turn out to have come with red flags.

docs.abstract: France is trying to become just the third nation to win consecutive World Cups.

headline.main: Mbappé and France Make a Statement in Extending Their Title Defense
headline.print_headline: With Mbappé, France Has Fuel For Title Defense

docs.lead_paragraph: DOHA, Qatar — After he scored yet another goal and carried France to yet another World Cup victory, Kylian Mbappé raced over to the sideline and held out one finger toward a television camera. As he made a sly grin, he held out another finger and then saluted with both — one for each goal he scored in France’s 3-1 victory over Poland in its round of 16 game on Sunday at Al Thumama Stadium.
docs.snippet: France is trying to become just the third nation to win consecutive World Cups.

docs.abstract: The experimental performing arts space purchased a 7,500-square-foot facility in the culture-rich neighborhood of Long Island City.

headline.main: Chocolate Factory Theater Finds a Permanent Home in Queens
headline.print_headline: Chocolate Factory Finds A New Home in Queens

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chocolate Factory Theater, a space for experimental performing arts in Long Island City, Queens, will put down roots there in a permanent home it recently purchased — in full, with no debt.
docs.snippet: The experimental performing arts space purchased a 7,500-square-foot facility in the culture-rich neighborhood of Long Island City.

docs.abstract: In other round of 16 matches, Liverpool will face Bayern, Barcelona will take on Lyon, and Tottenham will meet Dortmund.

headline.main: Manchester United to Face P.S.G. as Champions League Draw Is Made
headline.print_headline: Tough Draws for Champions League Favorites

docs.lead_paragraph: Liverpool vs. Bayern Munich and Manchester United vs. Paris St. Germain are two of the more enticing matchups in the round of 16 of the Champions League, which was drawn on Monday.
docs.snippet: In other round of 16 matches, Liverpool will face Bayern, Barcelona will take on Lyon, and Tottenham will meet Dortmund.

docs.abstract: Washington now sees Benjamin Netanyahu as the chief obstacle.

headline.main: What’s Stopping a Deal in Gaza?

docs.lead_paragraph: For weeks, the White House said the stars were aligned for a cease-fire agreement that would free the hostages held in Gaza. The framework of a deal first announced by President Biden has been in place since July. Since then, a phalanx of American officials has traveled frequently to the region, pushing Israel and Hamas to sign on. So far, they have failed.
docs.snippet: Washington now sees Benjamin Netanyahu as the chief obstacle.
